channel.title: Wiki Issues - Leakfree
channel.description: Topics in the 'Wiki Issues' category Broken links, missing information, problems editing, or pages you’d like to see? We should be able to help.

item.title: Unable to access Wiki: Error 522
item.dc:creator: Generalcamo
item.description:
Hey all. I’ve been trying to access the wiki for about a week now, but all I get is a Cloudflare page with an Error 522. I initially assumed this would be fixed quickly, but with more than a week passing and no update on this I’m not entirely sure. Will this be fixed anytime soon?

7 posts - 7 participants

Read full topic

Set $wgShowExceptionDetails = true; at the bottom of LocalSettings.php to show detailed debugging information.

Tried on Google Chrome and Edge.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: Weird spam links on some Wiki pages
item.dc:creator: cos
item.description:
Hey, I just wanted to let you guys know that there are a few dodgy links on the wiki.
The (no longer existing) user DomTheo apparently added them last May and November (2014) to the following pages:

Category:Chapters - there are 5 spammy links inserted after the description
https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Category:Chapters

Category:Weapons - there are 3 spammy links sprinkled around near the end of the description
https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Category:Weapons

It seems people are having trouble registering new wiki accounts, so maybe someone with an existing account can get in there and weed that stuff out.

7 posts - 6 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Weird spam links on some Wiki pages

item.title: Can't make a new account on the wiki
item.dc:creator: nicereddy
item.description:
I wanted to fix a spelling error in the FAQ (in the “Will <bug/glitch> in Half-Life be usable in Black Mesa” question), but I couldn’t make an account because when I tried to confirm my email it gave me an “Internal error”. I work on the PCGamingWiki, so if you guys are needing some MediaWiki help I can see what I can do (or get some other admins to come and try!).

3 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Can't make a new account on the wiki

item.title: Improving BM page on Wikipedia.org
item.dc:creator: Giazzo
item.description:
I was wondering that the Black Mesa page on Wikipedia, while being already good, isn’t updated with the newest events (post-release, I mean).

Since I actually do not have time to do it myself, but I see here a lot of people with more time and dedication than me: would someone kindly update the page?
Especially the “Reception” section: some reviews are already out, and even Metacritic and Gamerankings list Black Mesa. Something like this, with also quotations from game journalists. It would be give more “impact” to the mod, IMO.

Just an idea, don’t yell at me.

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Wiki - General Discussion
item.dc:creator: Conti
item.description:
Here is the place to share ideas and concentrate some general discussions about what is needed to improve the Black Mesa Wiki, ongoing projects, etc.

For bugs and other issues in the wiki, please post them in a separate post in this sub-forum.

Important links (check’em often to stay up-to-date of what is happening):

  • The BM-Wiki Guidelines

  • Wiki Community Portal

  • Recent Changes in the Wiki articles

7 posts - 5 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Missing user account?
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
Thanks to RM the wiki is now 2054 accounts lighter. That’s about 91.2% of all registered user accounts! We did our best to filter just the inactive spam accounts but a few legitimate accounts may have gotten caught up in the crossfire. If you have found that your wiki account has been removed please just re-register. You can use the same e-mail address as before and this should never happen again as a final wave of anti spam measures have been rolled out.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: Can't create new account
item.dc:creator: Solokiller
item.description:
Whenever i try to register an account on the wiki, i get this message:

Login error
The user account was not created, as we could not confirm its source. Ensure you have cookies enabled, reload this page and try again.

Cookies are enabled, i’ve tried reloading the page, and i’ve tried not asking it to remember my login for 180 days.

9 posts - 5 participants

Read full topic
